newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: Ascom says to sell unit Nexion.
newsitem.headline: Ascom says to sell unit Nexion.

text.p: Swiss telecommunications group Ascom Holding AG said it had signed an agreement to sell subsidiary Nexion pending approval by regulatory authorities in the United States.
"A contract for the sale of Nexion was signed on Tuesday, April 15, with an internationally active large company," Ascom said in a statement.
Ascom did not elaborate on the buyer but did say regulatory approval had to come from the United States "among other".
"Both contractual partnmers have agreed not to reveal any details of the negotiations," it added.
Nexion was spun off from troubled U.S. subsidiary Timeplex in 1994.
Nexion is a small development company that is working on a universal telecommunications switch which would connect local area networks, wide area networks and public networks.
Ascom's original intention was for Timeplex to be able to finance the expected start-up losses at Nexion for its switch.
